pageContext.claim: “I think we've done a fantastic job with bringing back the oil in a rapid fashion. That looked pretty bad. That'd look pretty bad...You had a case -- you had a couple of hours where if you bought a barrel of oil, you bought it for $37 -- as if they gave you $37. Okay? There's never been a thing like that ever. And now I see that it's getting close to $40 a barrel and you're back in business, and we got it done fast and we got Russia together with Saudi Arabia, and they cut production. And they got it back fast, and we're very, very proud of it.”
pageContext.analysis: Oil prices are still roughly half what they were at the beginning of 2020. Analysts have warned a coronavirus resurgence could add more instability to the market.
